description:
Pied Piper Storyland is a roll and move children's game made in Australia by G.N. Raymond in Melbourne during the 1950's.

The game board consists of a concentric path beginning at the Gates of Storyland where they place a wooden token. Players roll the dice and begin their inward  spiral journey through Storyland where they become accustom to the 50 Nursery Rhyme and Fairy-tale characters encountered. Players must obey the directions when landing on a Nursery Rhyme character and there are detours on the path that must be followed. First player to reach home in the center of the board is greeted by "Old King Cole" and declared the winner.

—user summary

Welcome to Häxjakten (the Witch Hunt)! A fast-paced race against the cauldron of destiny to decide who will be the witch master!

Häxjakten is a family game where you have to hunt for ingredients around all corners of the world to catch up with your opponents to brew your brews and become a witch master. But beware of the portal, monster attacks and the other witches who try to stand in your way.

Players roll the dice to move around the board and collect ingredient cards when landing on special spots.  They then have to move to the center of the board to brew their potion.  The first person to brew their potion, wins.

Häxjakten is created by Magnus Stenbenke from Växjö who runs the board game company Fungeon AB.

Simple racing game with 15 illustrations of how to behave in an air raid.

Standard roll and move mechanics.

date from Main POost Wurzburg article

Im Tigerenten Club is a game based on the German TV-show Tigerenten Club. It is a roll-and-move game. Some of the fields that a player may land on have special events, and others trigger a question from question cards on everyday topics. The winner is the first to reach the finish line.

—user summary

The question cards of this quiz/learning game are taken from children's everyday situations. On the front of each card is the picture and the German phrase. On the back is the English name together with child-friendly phonetic transcription for learning the correct pronunciation. You roll the dice and move on the map, on a question field you may translate an idiom. Whoever gets it right gets a chip, a question field without chips is considered an empty field. The first player to collect 8 chips wins.

—user summary

52 large search cards show 7 or 8 symbols, 52 task cards show two symbols each. The search cards are spread out on the table, task cards and three target cards are shuffled and stacked face down. The top task card is turned face up - a target card is set aside and a new card is turned face up. If there are symbols, everyone simultaneously looks for the only card that shows exactly these symbols and has the same background color. Whoever finds it grabs the snap card. If it is the right card, you keep the task card and put the snap figure back. If it is the wrong card, you sit out for the round and the others continue searching. When the third target card is revealed, the player with the most cards wins.

—user summary

Big washes, little washes is a game about washing clothes carefully. The right washing powder, the right temperature and the right speed. That is not easy because you can influence only one of those three factors, the others are determined by your opponents. On your turn, you determine one of those factors (i.e. washing powder) and play a card ( a piece of clothing). The others decide to join in (play a card) or pass. Then the next player determines another factor (i.e. temperature) and playes a card. Then, if also the spin cycle is determined the cards are turned and scored.

In Big washes, little washes you play 1 of 11 characters, each of which gives a different game experience. In addition, it has an expert mode where you can use your clothing cards in multiple ways and a solo campaign where you play all 11 characters, each with their own goal.

If you succeed, they can go clean in your wardrobe and you will receive your honestly earned points. But if your wardrobe is full, you have to make space by selling sets or outfits. Of course you also score points with that.

The game ends when the first player reaches 75 points. After that everybody can sell remaning sets/outfits from their wardrobe and the player with the most points wins.



Grote wasjes, kleine wasjes is een spel over het zorgvuldig wassen van kleren. Het juiste waspoeder, de juiste temperatuur en het juiste toerental. Dat valt niet mee omdat je zelf maar één van die drie factoren kunt beïnvloeden, de andere worden bepaald door je tegenspelers. In je beurt bepaal je een factor (bijvoorbeeld temperatuur) en speel je een kledingkaart. De andere besluiten mee te doen (door ook een kledingkaart te spelen) of te passen. Daarna bepaalt de volgende speler de temperatuur, speelt een kaart en de andere besluiten weer of ze nog meedoen. Als ook het toerental is bepaald draaien we de kaarten om en scoren we het resultaat. Als het lukt mogen ze schoon in je klerenkast en krijg je je eerlijk verdiende punten. Maar als je klerenkast vol is (er kunnen 8 stuks in je kast) dan moet je ruimte maken door sets of outfits te verkopen. Bijvoorbeeld een set van 5 paar sokken of 3 overhemden. Natuurlijk scoor je daar ook weer punten mee. Veel punten zelfs als het je lukt om bijvoorbeeld een complete zwarte of vintage outfit te verzamelen.

In Grote wasjes, kleine wasjes speel je 1 van de 11 karakters die elk weer een andere spelervaring geven. Bovendien heeft het een expert-modus waarbij je je kledingkaarten op meerdere manieren kunt benutten.

Het spel eindigt als de eerste speler 75 punten bereikt. Hierna mogen alle spelers nog sets/outfits uit hun kledingkast verkopen en de speler met de meeste punten wint.

Ten slotte is er solo-campagne waarbij je alle 11 karakters speelt die ieder hun eigen doel hebben.

The collection contains two IQ sets and builds on multiple disciplines when asking questions.
It is designed to test the ability of verbal, numerical, and spatial perception in roughly equal proportions.
If someone wants to know the real IQ value, they can give themselves a maximum of 120 minutes to solve the 40 problems, not more than a minute. If the player does not insist on strict adherence to the time limit, the evaluation will not show a real result.
It is not advisable to use a calculator when solving the tasks, because the tasks performed with numbers are intended to test the head count.
In evaluation, each correct answer is worth 1 point. In the game description, the player can also see the evaluation in scores and in the name of the IQ level.

Welcome to the class reunion of the graduates of the Goethe-Gymnasium of 2001. The celebration takes place in the sports hall of the former school and everyone is looking forward to reviving the good old times.

But long-forgotten secrets and intrigues also resurface. And then the former school spokesman Ralf Simon is found murdered in the workroom.

The question that remains is: Can you solve the criminal case together?

Mord bei Tisch "Klassentreffen" is a criminal dinner game in which 5-7 players can participate to find out who among them is the murderer of the found victim. In addition to that, every player gets a personal task to fulfil during the evening, which can include finding certain information via asking, hiding certain information during the game, convince other players to join them in certain acts or act in a very specific way during the game.

—description from the publisher (translated)

Each player receives a game piece and an order card with a number. The game pieces are moved by a dice roll and should reach or exceed the field with the drawn number. On the way, additional movement points can be gained on knowledge fields by correctly answering questions. Once a player has reached his target field, he immediately receives a new task. As soon as a player has completed his 6 target fields, he wins the game.

—user summary

A promotional game by Nestlé, produced by Otto Maier Verlag Ravensburg. Each player rolls the dice and moves his rabbit figure along a 71-square path. Along the way, there are instructions to follow on event squares that slow down or speed up movement. The player who reaches the destination square first wins.

—user summary

In The Guild of Merchant Explorers, each player starts with one city on their personal map board.

Shuffle the deck of terrain cards, then reveal most of these cards one by one. Based on the terrain revealed, each player places on their board cubes that are connected to their starting city or other cubes. You want to complete areas on your board, cross the seas to new land, and establish new cities on the board. You can explore capsized ships for treasure — which gives you special placement capabilities — and create linked connections between locations to score bonus points. Common objectives can be completed by all players, with those who complete it first scoring more points.

At the end of a round, all cubes are removed from each board, leaving only the cities behind, so if you don't establish new cities, you'll be stuck in the same places.

The Guild of Merchant Explorers contains multiple copies of four different maps, and the game is designed so that you can play remotely with one or more copies.

Class War is the new two-player asymmetric strategy game from the team behind Jacobin, the largest socialist magazine in the United States.

In Class War, you are a collective entity: a social class — either the Capitalists or the Workers. You’ll fight for social dominance in an unstable constitutional democracy. Will the Capitalists crush this rising wave of popular discontent and entrench their position as masters of society? Or will the Workers triumph over the power of money to make society more equal and just?

In Class War, players draw cards from their decks and deploy them in society using the money they earn in the economy. The cards you’ve played will be used to mobilize dice (representing your social power) against your opponent — in the economy, to win a greater slice of the economic pie, or in the state, to elect figures who support your political agenda. Ultimately, both classes aim to make their demands into law, permanently changing the rules of the game in their favor.

Compete to have the best stall with the best combination of monsters.

Socks Monster is a competitive game, in which we will have to take into account both sides of the cards: On one side we find the monsters and on the other the socks. The goal of the game is to finish with the most points at the end of the game, thanks to the connections of the socks and the bonuses of the monsters.

At the beginning of the game two cards are dealt to each player and with the remaining cards four equal draw decks are made showing the sides of the socks.

In turns, the player draws a card from any draw deck and then plays a card on the table. We must always start on our first turn with a monster and then follow the placement rules.

We will be playing cards forming our stall and making chains of socks to be able to lower other monsters. The socks are connected and superimposed following the placement rules and the requests of the monsters.

At the end of the game we will get points for the correct connections of the socks, the score bonuses of the monsters and we will subtract points for the stinky socks.

In addition, the game has a small variant, where the weather symbols come into play and add more interaction and bite to the game.

Hell in the Kitchen

Contaminated:  It's a quiet night in a suburban home when something animates the vegetables and sends them on a war of extermination!

Viral Vegetable Wars is a fast Micro Game of combat on the move as Humans and Vegetables try to eliminate each other.

You can take back your home if you have the guts and the gun.


     A Complete Micro Game
     Fast & Inexpensive
     Hours of Fun
     Expandable
     Bio-Degradable
     Politically Incorrect
     Dice Not Included


—description from the publisher

A wacky tactical wargame of humans fighting off animated vegetables seeking to escape from a household where the vegetables mysteriously sprang to life.

Designed to be played on a hex grid using counters, but the game can also be played directly on the tabletop. Each Human and Vegetable unit is rated for movement, attack, and defense. There are also weapons and other resource items that can be used to assist the Human player. Tri Tac's Bureau 13 can make a cameo appearance courtesy of an optional rule introducing those forces into the game.

The game portrays a battle to the death, where each side tries to eliminate the other. However, the humans can score a partial victory by getting the family into a car and escaping.

—user summary

In the North Pole, it’s the same story every year: Santa is trying to choose the best team of helpers on whom he will be able to count on to ensure the delivery of the presents during Christmas Night.

To select the best team, he relies on his companions to guide and lead some bold and daring elves through Santa’s 6 challenges. Each companion becomes head instructor for the elves. The aspiring elves’ ability in math, keen sense of observation, phonological awareness and general motor skills will be tried and tested. They will also be given the opportunity to demonstrate solidarity and kindness, two significant values in the North Pole...

—description from the publisher (translated)

Comme tous les ans, au pôle Nord, c’est la même histoire : père Noël cherche l’équipe de lutins sur laquelle il pourra compter pour l’aider à effectuer la livraison des cadeaux pendant la nuit de Noël.

Pour faire son choix, il compte sur ses acolytes pour guider et entraîner des lutins courageux à travers les 6 défis du père Noël. Chaque acolyte devient un maître entraîneur de lutin. Les aptitudes mathématiques, le sens de l’observation, la conscience phonologique et la motricité globale des aspirants lutins seront mis à l'entraînement. Ils auront aussi la chance de faire preuve d’entraide et de bienveillance, 2 valeurs très importantes au pôle Nord...

—description from the publisher

The Witches of Wickville are cursed! Every century, covens fight to be the first to complete the sacred ritual of the Grimoire. If you defeat the other witches OR summon your Guardian, you will break the curse, but if you fail, your coven will be banished to the shadows until the next ritual.

In Witches of Wickville, a game of witches in which from 1 to 4 players we can face each other to win the victory. The objective of the game is to be the first to light our candles to activate the ritual and wake up our guardian or we can also win by defeating the enemy by throwing the three cursed potions at him.

At the beginning of the game, the players choose a witch from each team who will represent their character during the game.

Then we place both guardians in the center of the table on their inactive side, shuffle the rest of the witchcraft cards and place them randomly on their inactive side, forming a circle around the guardians.

The game will take place in turns, in which we will have a compulsory action and two optional ones.

We must always move and optionally we can flip a card and/or use our character's ability.

Every time we flip a card, the cards activate an ability that must be executed, that card can produce chain effects, flip the next card, deactivate a specific card... and so on.

The first player to have all four candles lit and the grimoire book on the side of his color will activate his guardian, lighting his four candles a second time will make him the winner of the ritual.

But beware! With the yellow potions, if you throw all three potions you will damage the opposing witch, if you do it a second time, it will be another way to defeat him and win.

The Clinic is a psychological quiz game based on celebrity and popular culture, ideally for use as a party game.

The Clinic's gameplay is similar to psychological profile quizzes found in magazines, where players answer a series of multiple choice questions and eventually arrive at a set psychological profile at the end.

The game's name and theme comes from the UK media obsession with fame, celebrity, and the pressures of being in the spotlight, as illustrated by publications such as Heat (magazine), OK!, Hello! and similar. It seeks to play on the notion that any normal person can be thrust into the limelight via reality and talent shows such as Big Brother or The X Factor.

Nyx is a cat who lives with Petunia, the cutest apprentice witch you have ever seen, and they take care of each other, along with doing a lot of trickery. Nyx is getting old, though, and preparing to retire, so Petunia will be need of a new companion soon! That's why they're looking to adopt a new kitten to learn all about being a witches' cat!

Each player controls a magic copy of a cat, who will try to showcase their skills to either reach the tower at the center of the board or capture 3 cats from other players.

Every turn they will place their movement tile on the table and, in ascending order, jump to an adjacent roof with the same color or number. They can also use magic portals to navigate from one edge to another. If at any point they meet another cat, this one will be captured unless they yield a treat to distract!

Petunia also offers treats that can be traded for attack, defense and trick cards, or by keys to the tower. At the end of every round, one of the players moves Nyx, shattering a roof and creating new portals and connections!

The creatures of Blorb 212 were more than a match for the first explorers that tried to take their world. When a series of attempts to colonize the planet failed, the company that had claimed Blorb 212 waited. After a few years of planning, they began dropping machines down to the planet’s surface to rid it of the mutant monsters that lived there.

The company never figured on the damage to their robots from the blue-white sun. The robots soon began battling each other as well as the monsters.

Realizing they could never colonize the world, the company began sponsoring contests for engineers to build specialized combat robots.

With orbital and ground monitors it became the new spectator sport of the 23rd century.

—description from the publisher

Sculpt your own combat robots from clay then assign the game characteristics for armor, movement, weaponry, flight capability, and head and body styles. Then fight out a battle on the tabletop using the Squash miniatures rules system. Optional rules include initiative, advanced weapons, terrain, and power cells.

—user summary

The creatures of Blorb 212 were more than a match for the first explorers that tried to take over their world. When a series of attempts to colonize the planet failed, the company that had claimed Blorb 212 waited. After a lot of years of planning, they began dropping the ultimate biological weapon down to the Planet’s surface to rid it of the mutant monsters that lived there.

The company never figured on the mutating effects from the 'Zilla Class' bio-chemicals combined with the blue-white sun. The monsters soon began battling each other as they mutated into new and stranger life forms.

Realizing they could never colonize the world, the company began watching the monsters and realized it was a source of cheap entertainment until they could come up with a better idea. With orbital and ground monitors, it became the new spectator sport of the 23rd century.

—description from the publisher

Sculpt your own kaijÅ« style monsters from clay. Next, assign them game characteristics for armor, movement, weaponry, and flight capability. Then fight out battles on the tabletop using the Squash miniatures rules system. Optional rules include advanced weapons (such as atomic breath), initiative, terrain, and energy cells.

—user summary

The creatures of Blorb 212 were more than a match for the first explorers that tried to take over their world. When a series of attempts to colonize the planet failed, the company that had claimed Blorb 212 waited. After a few years of planning, they began dropping Mecs down to the Planet’s surface to rid it of the mutant monsters that lived there.

But this failed also and the company that would call the planet their own, decided on a new course of action. The next step was to create a vast army of mutant insects to destroy the Monsters and Robots.

Like everything else tried on this hostile world, the plan backfired. The BUGS began to attack everything, including themselves, as they mutated into new and bizarre forms.

The battle was on!

—description from the publisher

Sculpt your own alien BUGS from clay based on a number of traditional insect body types. Next assign your BUGS game characteristics for armor, movement, natural weaponry, and flight capability. Then fight out battles on the tabletop using the Squash miniatures rules system. Optional rules include initiative, advanced weapons, terrain, and food cells.

—user summary

Lindisfarne Monastery is a competitive euro-style dice worker placement game about monks working at a Christian monastery in the early Medieval period. Inspired by the real monastery of Lindisfarne, players work to create resources, feed themselves, and write religious texts for the library, culminating in the great Lindisfarne Gospels.

The monks are represented by dice, and the pips on the dice represent their level of experience. As the monks are placed on action spaces each round, their pips are converted to action points to spend in that action space. Each round, the player who has pip majority in each action space may claim an available bonus, which may include the ability to pip up a die.

Monks can also be sent in pilgrimage to holy sites overseas, and to collect rare, vivid inks to take home for use in their scriptorium. The monks must also beware the Vikings, who raid the monastery every summer, and who must be paid off in beer and mead, lest they steal the treasures of the monastery or murder the monks!

A full game of Lindisfarne Monastery is played over four game rounds, representing calendar years, where in each year there are two action phases, and within each action phase the monk dice are placed, and then resolved. Points are scored from pilgrimage, from writing religious texts, commissioning treasures for the monastery chapel, and for retiring monk dice from the board. The player with the highest total score at the end of the game is declared the winner.

—description from the designer

A new pencil-and-paper game for one or two players.

Taking turns, players draw straight lines on a grid of n × n dots, with n ≥ 3. Each line must connect at least 3 dots, all adjacent. From the second move, each line that is drawn must contain exactly one dot from the previous line. Lines may not be partially or totally overlapping. On each turn, and after having drawn a line, the player has the option of removing a free dot from the grid—that is, a dot that is not part of any line. 
The player who makes the last move wins.

Published in Decemeber 2021 issue of Games World of Puzzles Magazine

The game consists of 5 exercises where players can score points. Whoever has collected the most points after the 5 exercises wins the game.
Exercise 1: Reaction test
Exercise 2: Memory test
Exercise 3: Skill test
Exercise 4: Combination test
Exercise 5: Faultfinding test

—user summary

The players move their game pieces over a circuit by rolling the dice and can win money from the bank on the individual fields, lose money to the piggy bank or receive the collected contents of the piggy bank. The first player to collect 10 marks wins the game.

—user summary

A mystery box filled with puzzles, evidence, and interviews will be delivered to your door. Each box is a standalone mystery that requires no additional boxes to complete.

Hillview Academy is the most elite private school in Valley Falls.  Six of Hillview’s finest receive a mysterious invitation in their locker to participate in something called The Legacy Game. The game will begin promptly at midnight in the local cemetery at the gravesite of Jefferson F. Pritchard, which the letter describes as one of Valley Falls' most infamous citizens.  The invitation, sent from someone calling themselves The Headmaster, promises a life-changing reward for the winner.  However, no one has ever heard of Jefferson F. Pritchard, and Hillview Academy doesn't have a headmaster.  What is The Legacy Game, who is The Headmaster, and what is so special about a dead man that doesn't show up in any of the Valley Falls history books?  Play The Legacy Game and find out!

Fill all the seats on the Round Table. Each turn you can fill one or two (adjacent) seats. The player filling the last seat wins.

The game reimplements Nimclock, a Nim variant.

Published on History Kids, Italian edition, issue #5.

—user summary

MasterMinds is a GAME OF DEDUCTION where in order to determine who the MasterMind is, what they're like and where they are, you need to make your way around the board and ask the right questions of the other players using your deductive reasoning skills and the process of elimination, trying to be the first to solve the mystery of who and where the MasterMind is and climb their steps to knock on their door.

In a standard game, each player holds three cards, Description, Character and Place. The remaining 3 cards for the round are the MasterMind's cards. With the occasional advantage or disadvantage of Bonuses and Penalties players make their way around the board Asking Questions and Taking Notes using their Solver Pad until they're ready to Climb The Steps to Make Their Guess and find out if they're at the MasterMinds Door!

Is the MasterMind a Lonely Zombie In Your Closet, a Kind Grandma At The Grocery Store, a Frustrated Time Traveler In The Woods???...It could be anyone, anywhere, IT'S TIME TO PLAY AND FIGURE IT OUT!

—description from the publisher

A ziplocked compilation of "Eight Classic and Strange Micro Games" (per the cover blurb) from Tri Tac.

—user summary

Polar Smash, which debuted as Igloo Mania, is a game that requires a steady hand! Keep your cool! Don't let the pressure and tension get to you or Parka Pete could fall to his feet - straight through the igloo! Parka Pete has finally placed his last block of ice to complete his igloo. But those pesky penguins have to ruin everything! They're playing a game with their ice picks and pulling out the ice blocks, unbeknownst to Parka Pete. Don't be the penguin who lets him fall into his igloo - or you'll be the losing penguin and Parka Pete will have to start his igloo all over again. A game easy enough for the kids to set up and play on their own, but a fun enough game that even the adults will want to play!

The player who collapses the igloo loses, then the player who has collected the fewest ice blocks wins.

Hunter. Adventurer. The greatest marksman to ever live. You are Allan Quatermain, searching for wealth deep in colonial era Africa. Grab your gun and wisely choose your allies as you compete in this deck building adventure game. 2-4 players will go on adventures, hunt in the veldt, and trade for new additions to their decks. Try to amass the most wealth, but beware, your allies will determine how many wealth cards you can score at game end.

Each turn consists of four steps:
- Upkeep, if applicable
- Play up to one adventure card
- Go hunting in the veldt
- Make up to one trade for new cards

As you gain new adventure cards, they will open up additional actions, plus you can get upgraded guns to aid in hunting, and allies which remain in play. During Upkeep you select one gun and one ally to journey with you that turn. The game continues until the veldt runs out of animals, at which time whoever can score the most wealth wins.

Cinematics is a card game in which players, in the role of director, make various films and participate in international film festivals and win various awards.
Players can use famous superstars to improve the quality of their movies, edit their movies or promote them in various media.

In Cinematic, players must purchase the plan (shot) cards through the special rules of the game to make a movie and then, they must put together genres or matching Kelakets based on the rules, so they can finally create a sequence.
No dice are used in this game and the winner of the game is the one who gets the most points based on the opinions of the jury mentioned in the festival card.
In addition to the main prize of the festival, other players can also win prizes in categories such as “best actor”, “best director”, etc.

In HE.R.O you are a recently gratuated doctor who needs to serve the first nighshift at the E.R. You will manage patients, upgrade your skills to treat complicated cases, try to get enough sleep and all while not causing too much Chaos.

HE.R.O can be played in cooperative or competitive mode and will include rules for both.

Each player receives a knight and a die. The knights are moved towards each other along the tournament path by a dice roll until they meet. Whoever can push the foreign knight back to his starting point with dice rolls wins a tournament point. The first player to achieve an agreed sum of tournament points wins the game.

—user summary

Take your team to the championship and become the best quarterback in the league along the way. This solitaire game is a mashup of the Dungeon Ball theme and the Hunted system.

Dungeon Ball Legend can be played in two modes: Exhibition (one game) or Season (six games). In each game, you’ll attempt to guide your team to victory by scoring more points than your opponent, and you’ll try to rack up as many highlights as possible to gain votes in the race to win the Hegzug Trophy (it’s kind of like the Heisman…).

—description from the publisher

Classical chess has its deserved place as the Western reference of abstract strategic games, this game was conceived as one of the various variants and derivatives of "Chaturanga" (game of Indian origin), under that line this proposal derives from classic chess modifying and contributing in mechanics and themes with the intention of providing a fun, modern, accessible, dynamic and deep game alternative.

A mediator chooses a photo and delivers 5 cards with phrases to each of the other players. Players choose one of the provocative phrases for the photo and vote for the best one. If your idea is the most creative, congratulations! You gained in talent. He is an advertising genius and gets points for that and a new round is held. The first player to reach a number of points wins.

—user summary

In Rainbow 7, you discard one or more cards from your hand each turn, but they keep coming back...

The deck in this game consists of 49 cards in seven colors from 1-7, as well as four rainbow cards valued at X. Each player starts with a hand of six random cards from 1-6 and one random 7. On a turn, you discard a single card or a group of three or more cards that are either the same number or color; if you discard a 7 as part of a group, you carry out the special effect of the card, such as discarding a rain token or forcing everyone else to draw a card. Place played cards on the three discard piles as you wish, then draw one card from the top of a discard pile or the deck and add it to your hand.

Alternatively, if the sum of cards in your hand is at most 7, you can call "Rainbow [sum]", e.g. "Rainbow 3". If no one else has a lower score than you, you win the round, and everyone else gains two rain tokens; if someone is lower, you gains three rain tokens, and no one else gains tokens.

Finally, if on a turn you play out the remaining cards in your hand, the round ends, and everyone else gains one rain token.

If a player has at least seven rain tokens, the game ends, and whoever has the fewest rain tokens wins. If not, start another round...

Build the house from the map as quick as possible. A re-edition of La Boca with new art and a two player mode.

Creating skylines of similar beauty and eccentricity is the goal of the construction teams that play Recto Verso. In shifting teams of two that sit across from one another, players try to create skylines on challenge cards – but the players can see the completed image only from their point of view, so they must consult with one another constantly to make sure each colored block ends up in the right location while racing against the timer. The faster the players complete their building, the more points they score. Then the next team takes a seat, breaks down the blocks, then begins building anew. Whoever has the most points after a certain number of rounds wins.

A new 2 player cooperative mode has been added to this edition.

Super Snipers is a head-to-head sniper dueling game featuring a familiar Tetris mechanic used in a novel and exciting way.

In Super Snipers, players assume the roles of genetically and cybernetically enhanced soldiers, each racing to locate and kill the other Super Sniper first. They do this by placing polyominoes (called “Focus”) onto grids. They must locate their opponent, isolate innocent bystanders, and make their kill. The first player to make 3 kills wins.

Super Snipers has a simultaneous turns Duel Mode, a real-time Quickdraw Mode, a solo turn-based Contract Mode against an automa, and an intense solo real-time Hostage Rescue Mode against two automa in a hostage situation.

—description from the designer

Nomad is a family game for more experienced players. 
A nomadic tribe decides to move their camp to a remote but more suitable land. The chief hunter sets off to explore the unknown area and find the best route, and he will also acquire food for the tribe by hunting. However, the outcome of his actions will be largely determined by the prayers of the tribe’s shaman.

The game is played in 12 rounds. Players have their own terrain boards where they advance their hunter and move their camp (a yurt) towards the desired location in the farthest corner of the board.  At the beginning of each round, the shamans offer sacrifices to the Goddess of Nature on the shaman hill. This will determine the order of players, and therefore the outcome of the next, preparation phase. Finally, players execute their actions: exploration by placing terrain tiles on the board, hunting, or moving their camp further.

When the game ends, players add up their scores received for the areas explored, the animals hunted and the distance they have reached with the camp. In addition, they can earn various bonuses for terrain tiles positioned in a smart way. Connected areas of the same terrain type on their board may also give multiple points, depending on size; some of these are easier, some more challenging to build. The player with the highest scores wins.

In Nomad, everyone builds the landscape for themselves, but this is by no means a solitary experience. Although there is a good deal of interaction during the first two phases, players make decisions on their own. This game is ideal for 2-4 players, playing time is about 1 hour.

—description from the publisher (translated)

A Nomad családi játék, gyakorlottabb játékosok számára. 
Egy nomád törzs elhatározza, hogy átköltözteti a táborát egy távolabbi helyre. Az ismeretlen táj felfedezésére elÅ‘re küldi a legjobb vadászát, aki megkeresi az optimális utat és élelmet is szerez. Akcióinak kimenetelét azonban nagyban befolyásolja, hogy mennyire eredményesen imádkozik a törzs sámánja a természet istennÅ‘jéhez.

A játék 12 fordulóból áll. Minden játékos a saját tereptábláján halad elÅ‘re a vadásszal, és ott mozgatja a tábort jelképezÅ‘ jurtát a leendÅ‘ táborhely felé a tábla átellenes sarkában.  A forduló azzal kezdÅ‘dik, hogy a sámándombon a törzsek sámánjai áldozatot mutatnak be az istennÅ‘nek. Ekkor alakul ki a játékosok sorrendje, mely meghatározza a következÅ‘, felkészülÅ‘ fázis menetét. Majd ezt követik az akciók: a terep felfedezése tereplapkák lehelyezésével, vadászat, vagy a tábor mozgatása.

A játék végén a felfedezett területekért, az elejtett vadakért, valamint a táborral megtett távolságért pontokat kapnak a játékosok, sÅ‘t a tereplapkák ügyes illesztésével különféle bónuszokat is szerezhetnek. Sok pontot hozhatnak a táblán az összefüggÅ‘ területek, amelyek közül némelyik könnyebb, másik jóval nehezebb módon építhetÅ‘ ki. Az gyÅ‘z, aki a legtöbb pontot szerzi.

A Nomad játékban ugyan mindenki magának építi a tájat, de ez korántsem jelent szoliter élményt. Az elsÅ‘ két fázis során épp elegendÅ‘ interakcióba keverednek a játékosok, azonban a saját táblájuk felett a döntést csak egyedül gyakorolják. A játék 2-4 játékos számára ideális szórakozás, egy játszma kb. 1 órán át tart.

—description from the publisher

Fais-toi une idée is nothing like the classic puzzle game. Using a clue as well as a series of images, you have to make deductions and be creative to decode, with your team, as many puzzles as possible ... in 30 seconds flat.

Commemorating the 20th anniversary of the phenomenal series, FULLMETAL ALCHEMIST, comes a board game based on the beloved anime FULLMETAL ALCHEMIST BROTHERHOOD.

In this cooperative board game, players take on the roles of some of the series’ most iconic characters, while working together to take down the creeping mannequin soldiers and dreadful homunculi and complete the Reverse Transmutation Circle. Take on the challenge solo or with a group of 2 to 4 players. The difficulty can be changed between Novice, Hard, and Ultimate – the last being a true test of strategy and skill.

“The Promised Day” in Central has arrived. Edward Elric, the Fullmetal Alchemist, and his allies aim to activate the Reverse Transmutation Circle to counter the homunculus’ Countrywide Transmutation circle. Do you have what it takes to stop Father’s ambitions?

—description from the publisher

In this trivia game, one question and 4 answers about Augsburg are read out in turn. At least one answer is correct and at least one answer is wrong. The other two answers can be wrong or right. All players now guess which answers are correct. Each player can place at least one, but no more than 3, guessing stones. If you guess an incorrect answer, you do not win any points. All other players receive one point for each correct answer. The player who has collected the most points after an agreed number of questions wins the game.

—user summary

The fourth core set of our libre fantasy style strategic card game Arcmage.

As you battle your opponents summoning creatures and casting spells, you’ll have to defend your cities, manage your resources and power supply and conjure up a strategical plan to beat your opponents. Will you be the one that brings order to the warring factions in Irdiya? Will you challenge all and utter the words ‘Amin duna, ilya lanta’?

This turn based game allows a player to gather resources, build cities, cast and move creatures, recruit an army, play magic spells or interrupt an opponents' play. Each turn the player may launch an attack on an a target city. On opponents' turns players may have to bravely defend their cities against the marauding enemy's army. Lose all of your cities and you're out of the game.

Following the tradition of many great CCG's, the game supports both casual as in depth strategic game play. Furthermore it offers an unique resource system and adds a spacial dimension that lets the player decide how and where to deploy their creatures.

—description from the designer

You and your friends must free your pets from the monsters!
Monsters have robbed your pets of your city. The adults have not been able to stop them, but now you and your friends have decided that it must be enough! You have figured out a way to disguise yourself as a monster and go into their villages to save your pets. You have to dress in the right color combinations - then the magic locks open!

The one who saves the most pets wins the game round and becomes the biggest hero in your city!

You start the game with 1-3 masking parts and changes / develops during the game by acquiring different parts: head, wings, tail, feet and so on. During the game, you may want to change the color combination on your masking parts depending on what colors the different magic locks to the villages have. Masking parts are placed in special squares on the board where you have to go to collect them.

If you have enough masking parts in the right color combination, you can open the lock to a village. For example, if one lock to a village have two red and one yellow square, you can get into that village if you have at least two red mask parts and at least one yellow masking member. You must hit the dice high enough to reach up to the red dice mark. You stay always on the red dice whether you have more steps left, then roll the dice again and move corresponding step into the village or castle. Each box has a number with plus or minus: add up all the numbers from the boxes you pass and land on - the sum is the number of animal tokens you can pick up.

Then to get into the castle, where you have a chance
To free most animals, you must have five masking parts with at least one part in each color (yellow, green & red) to get inside. This is the hardest to do, but you can also save the most pets here.
